str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: From ek and poreuomai; to depart, be discharged, proceed, project.
Lit: I dip, submerge, but specifically of ceremonial dipping; I baptize.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Offspring, child, fruit. From gennao; offspring; by analogy, produce.
A serpent, snake, viper. Of uncertain origin; an adder or other poisonous snake.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To indicate, intimate, suggest, show, prove. From hupo and deiknuo; to exhibit under the eyes, i.e. to exemplify.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
To flee, escape, shun. Apparently a primary verb; to run away; by implication, to shun; by analogy, to vanish.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
From oregomai; properly, desire, i.e., violent passion (justifiable) abhorrence); by implication punishment.
